apiOperation.shortdesc: Adds a secondary, descending, sort condition to the IOrderedEnumerable

apiReturn.apiDesc: An IOrderedObservable that can be enumerated or further ordered using methods available on IOrderedObservable

apiParam.apiDesc: A function that retrieves the key used to order the values in the source sequence: function(element : TElement) : TKey
(optional) A function that compares key values. The return value should follow rules of the compareFunction in Array.sort: function(x : TKey, y : TKey) : int

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Adds a secondary, descending, sort condition to the IOrderedEnumerable

apiOperation.shortdesc: Adds a secondary sort condition to the IOrderedEnumerable

apiReturn.apiDesc: An IOrderedObservable that can be enumerated or further ordered using methods available on IOrderedObservable

apiParam.apiDesc: A function that retrieves the key used to order the values in the source sequence: function(element : TElement) : TKey
(optional) A function that compares key values. The return value should follow rules of the compareFunction in Array.sort: function(x : TKey, y : TKey) : int

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Adds a secondary sort condition to the IOrderedEnumerable

apiOperation.shortdesc: Determines if the every value in the source sequence matches a predicate function.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if the sequence is empty or all the values in the sequence match the predicate; false otherwise

apiParam.apiDesc: (optional) A function in the format: function(element : TElement) : Boolean

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Determines if the every value in the source sequence matches a predicate function.
Uses immediate execution and stops enumerating when a negative match is found.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Determines if the predicate argument function returns true for any item in the sequence.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if a matching value is found or if predicate is null and the sequence contains any values; false otherwise

apiParam.apiDesc: (optional) A function in the format: function(element : TElement) : Boolean

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Determines if the predicate argument function returns true for any item in the sequence. If no function is supplied, true will be returned if the sequence contains any values
Uses immediate execution and stops enumerating when a match is found.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Retrieves the average value in the sequence.

apiReturn.apiDesc: The average value of the sequence

apiParam.apiDesc: (optional) If specified, determines the numeric value of the element

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Retrieves the average value in the sequence. Throws an IllegalOperationError if the sequence is empty.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns a new sequence that will seemlessly enumerate a second sequence after the first sequence completes

apiReturn.apiDesc: A new sequence that contains the values from the first and second sequence, in order

apiParam.apiDesc: The sequence to enumerate after the first sequence

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns a new sequence that will seemlessly enumerate a second sequence after the first sequence completes

apiOperation.shortdesc: Determines if the source sequence contains a specific value, optionally using an equalityComparer function.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true if a match was found; false otherwise

apiParam.apiDesc: The value to be compared
(optional) A function to compare two values: function(x : TElement, y : TValue) : Boolean

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Determines if the source sequence contains a specific value, optionally using an equalityComparer function.
Uses immediate execution and stops enumerating when a match is found

apiOperation.shortdesc: Determines the number of elements in the sequence.

apiOperation.shortdesc:
Returns a new sequence that will return the given defaultValue
Uses deferred execution

apiReturn.apiDesc: A new IEnumerable sequence

apiParam.apiDesc: (optional) The default value to use if the sequence is empty. If not supplied, the value will be converted from null (int = 0, boolean = false, etc)

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Returns a new sequence that will return the given defaultValue
Uses deferred execution

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns a new sequence that only contains the unique values in the original sequence.

apiReturn.apiDesc: A new sequence that contains the distinct values of the original sequence

apiParam.apiDesc: (optional) If specified, returns a unique value for the element: function(element : TElement) : THash

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Returns a new sequence that only contains the unique values in the original sequence.
If the sequence contains values that are not natively comparable (String, u/int, Number, Boolean), a hashSelector should be specified to return a value that is. An example of this would be to return the ID property of an entity.
Uses deferred execution

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns the element at the given index or a default value if the sequence does not contain that many elements.

asCustoms.defaultValue: The value to return if the sequence does not contain (index+1) elements

apiReturn.apiDesc: The value at index

apiParam.apiDesc: The zero-based index of the value to return

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns the element at the given index or a default value if the sequence does not contain that many elements.

apiReturn.apiDesc: The value at index

apiParam.apiDesc: The zero-based index of the value to return

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns the element at the given index or throws an IllegalOperationError if the sequence does not contain that many elements.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns a new sequence that contains the values in the source sequence that do not exist in the supplied sequence

apiParam.apiDesc: (optional) A predicate used to match values: function(element : TElement) : Boolean

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns the first element in the sequence or returns a default value if the sequence is empty. If predicate is supplied, the first value to match the predicate will be returned with the default value being returned if no values match the predicate

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns the first element in the sequence or throws an IllegalOperationError if the sequence is empty.

apiReturn.apiDesc: The first value in the sequence or the first value in the sequence that matches predicate

apiParam.apiDesc: (optional) A predicate used to match values: function(element : TElement) : Boolean

apiOperation.shortdesc: Groups elements of a sequence using a key selector function

apiReturn.apiDesc: A sequence that has elements of type IGrouping, where each IGrouping is a sequence of values of type TElement and a key

apiParam.apiDesc: Retrieves the key for a value in the sequence: function(source : TSource) : TKey
(optional) If specified, maps the source element to an element to place in the grouping: function(source : TSource) : TElement
(optional) If specified, returns a natively comparable value for a key in the sequence: function(key : TKey) : THash

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Groups elements of a sequence using a key selector function

apiOperation.shortdesc:
Correlates the elements of two sequences based on keys and groups the results
Uses immediate execution on the inner sequence, uses deferred executino on the outer (source) sequence

apiReturn.apiDesc: A sequence that has elements of type TResult that are obtained by joining outer and inner sequences.

apiParam.apiDesc: The sequence to join to the first sequence. Can be any value that can be converted to an IEnumerable using toEnumerable
Retrieves the key from values in the outer (source) sequence: function(element : TOuterElement) : TKey
Retrieves the key from values in the inner sequence: function(element : TInnerElement) : TKey
Creates a result element from the source sequence and a sequnce of matching values from the inner sequence: function(outer : TOuterElement, inner : IEnumerable.<TInnerElement>) : TResult
(optional) Returns a natively comparable value for a key: function(key : TKey) : THash

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Correlates the elements of two sequences based on keys and groups the results
Uses immediate execution on the inner sequence, uses deferred executino on the outer (source) sequence

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns a new sequence that contains only the values contained in both sequences

apiReturn.apiDesc: A new sequence containing the unique values contained in both sequence

apiParam.apiDesc: The right side of the intersection. Can be any value that can be converted to an IEnumerable using toEnumerable
(optional) If specified, returns a unique value for the element: function(element : TElement) : THash

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns a new sequence that contains only the values contained in both sequences

apiOperation.shortdesc: Correlates the elements of two sequences based on keys.

apiReturn.apiDesc: A sequence that has elements of type TResult that are obtained by joining outer and inner sequences.

apiParam.apiDesc: The sequence to join to the first sequence. Can be any value that can be converted to an IEnumerable using toEnumerable
Retrieves the key from values in the outer (source) sequence: function(element : TOuterElement) : TKey
Retrieves the key from values in the inner sequence: function(element : TInnerElement) : TKey
Creates a result element from two matching elements: function(outer : TOuterElement, inner : TInnerElement) : TResult
(optional) Returns a natively comparable value for a key: function(key : TKey) : THash

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Correlates the elements of two sequences based on keys.
Uses immediate execution on the inner sequence, uses deferred executino on the outer (source) sequence

apiParam.apiDesc: (optional) A predicate used to match values: function(element : TElement) : Boolean

apiOperation.shortdesc: Maps a sequence for each value in the source sequence and concatonates the results into a single sequence.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Maps a sequence for each value in the source sequence and concatonates the results into a single sequence. Uses deferred execution.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Projects (converts) values using a selector function.

apiParam.apiDesc: Projects the values from the source sequence: function(element : TElement) : TResult

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Projects (converts) values using a selector function. Uses deferred execution

apiOperation.shortdesc: Retrieves the maximum element in the sequence.

(optional) If specified, compares the value (either element value or the value returned by valueSelector): function(value : TValue) : int

Retrieves the maximum element in the sequence. Throws an IllegalOperationError if the sequence is empty.
If the comparison value (either the original element or the value returned by valueSelector) cannot be natively ordered (ie. is not String, u/int or Number), a comparer should be supplied to compare the values

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:

If the comparison value (either the original element or the value returned by valueSelector) cannot be natively ordered (ie. is not String, u/int or Number), a comparer should be supplied to compare the values

apiOperation.shortdesc: Aggregates values in a sequence using functions passed as arguments.

apiReturn.apiDesc: The return value of resultSelector (if supplied) or the final accumulate value if resultSelector is not supplied

apiParam.apiDesc: The initial value for the accumulation
A function that returns the new accumulated value: function(accumulate : TAccumulate, element : TElement) : TAccumulate
(optional) A function that maps the final accumulate value before being returned

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Aggregates values in a sequence using functions passed as arguments.
Accumulates a value, starting with seed, by calling accumulator for each value in the source sequence and using the return value as the new accumulated value. When the sequence completes, the accumulated value is (optonally) mapped through resultSelector before being returned.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Repeats the source sequence a specified number of times

apiReturn.apiDesc: A sequence containing values of the same type as the source

apiParam.apiDesc: (optional) The number of times to repeat the sequence. If 0, the sequence will be repeated indefinately

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Repeats the source sequence a specified number of times

apiOperation.shortdesc: Reverses the values in the source sequence

apiReturn.apiDesc: A new sequence containing the reversed values of the source sequence

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Reverses the values in the source sequence

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns a sequence that aggregates values using functions passed as arguments, using deferred execution and returning the values accumulated values as they are returned.

apiReturn.apiDesc: A sequence of type TAccumulate that can be enumerated

apiParam.apiDesc: The initial value for the accumulation
A function that returns the new accumulated value: function(accumulate : TAccumulate, element : TElement) : TAccumulate
(optional) A function that maps the final accumulate value before being returned

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Returns a sequence that aggregates values using functions passed as arguments, using deferred execution and returning the values accumulated values as they are returned.
Accumulates a value, starting with seed, by calling accumulator for each value in the source sequence and using the return value as the new accumulated value. Each time a new value is accumulated, the accumulated value is (optonally) mapped through resultSelector before being returned.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Determines whether two sequences are equal.

Supports null keys Returns an empty sequence for requests for keys that do not exist

apiOperation.shortdesc: Aggregates values in a sequence using functions passed as arguments.

apiReturn.apiDesc: The return value of resultSelector (if supplied) or the final accumulate value if resultSelector is not supplied

apiParam.apiDesc: The initial value for the accumulation
A function that returns the new accumulated value: function(accumulate : TAccumulate, element : TElement) : TAccumulate
(optional) A function that maps the final accumulate value before being returned

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Aggregates values in a sequence using functions passed as arguments.
Accumulates a value, starting with seed, by calling accumulator for each value in the source sequence and using the return value as the new accumulated value. When the sequence completes, the accumulated value is (optonally) mapped through resultSelector before being returned.

(optional) A function that maps the final accumulate value before being returned

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Returns a sequence that aggregates values using functions passed as arguments, using deferred execution and returning the values accumulated values as they are returned.
Accumulates a value, starting with seed, by calling accumulator for each value in the source sequence and using the return value as the new accumulated value. Each time a new value is accumulated, the accumulated value is (optonally) mapped through resultSelector before being returned.

apiParam.apiDesc: The right hand side of the join

A function that will accept "live" left/right value combinations and return a new value. The output of this function will be received by any subscribers: function(left : TLeft, rights : IObservable.<TRight>) : TResult

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Combines values from two streams based on the "lifetime" of each value, represented by an IObservable selected for each value. An IObervable set of "right" values are sent with its matching "left" value to a selector to be combined. The output of this selector is emitted to the output stream
